column5: English
column11: English

column5: Hey, look!
column11: Hey, look!

column4:
こっちへ来るぞ！
逃げろ！
column5:
It's headed this way!
RUN FOR IT!
column11:
It's headed this way!
Run for it!

column4: ガロイ親方＿戦闘中真剣

column5: What's this alarm siren!?
column11: What's this alarm siren!?

column4:
父さん、大変！！
/c5オートマン/c3が街に侵入したって！
column5:
Dad, it's terrible!
An /c5Automan/c3 has breached the city!
column11:
Dad, it's terrible!! 
There's an /c5Automan/c3 invading the streets!

column5: What did you say!?
column11: What did you just say!?

column4:
オートマン？
なんだそれ？
column5:
An Automan?
What's that?
column11:
An Automan?
What's that?

column4:
人形師ファウストが
作った自動人形だよ。
column5: They're automatic Puppets created by the Puppetmaker Faust.
column11: They're automatic mechs created by the Puppet Maker, Faust.

column4: 無人で動く、自動制御人形。
column5: They don't need a pilot to drive them -- they're autonomous Puppets.
column11: They don't need a pilot to drive them, in other words-they're autonomous mechs.

column4:
人形作りの歴史において、
最大の発明ともいえるシロモノ
だったんだけどね。
column5: They're said to be the greatest invention in the entire history of Puppet manufacturing.
column11: In the entire history of mech manufacture, they're said to be the greatest invention.

column4:
問題は思考が不安定で、
制御がきかないってことさ。
column5: The problem is that their thought processes are unstable, and they don't always function correctly.
column11: The problem is that their thought-processes are unstable, and they don't always function correctly.

column4:
ずいぶん気分屋でね。
時々、狂ったように
暴れまわるのさ。
column5: It's a major concern. Sometimes they get out of control and go berserk.
column11: It's seriously concerning. Sometimes they become out of control and go berserk.

column4:
先月は、
暴走オートマンのせいで、
街が一つ壊滅したよ。
column5: Last month, a whole town was destroyed by an Automan rampage.
column11: Last month, a whole town was destroyed by a rampaging Automan.

column4:
狂ったオートマンは
破壊の化身だ。
column5: An out-of-control Automan is destruction incarnate.
column11: That out-of-control Automan is the very incarnation of destruction.

column4:
このままだと街は廃墟になるぞ！
自警団はどうした！？
column5: The city will be in ruins if this keeps up! What about the vigilantes!?
column11: The city will be in ruins if this keeps up! What about the vigilantes!?

column4:
蹴散らされたよ。街の外で
オートマンを迎え撃ったん
だけど、ダメだった。
column5: They've disbanded. They tried to ambush the Automan outside of the city, but it was hopeless.
column11: They've disbanded. They tried to ambush the Automan outside of the city, but it was hopeless.

column4:
ダメージを与えるのが
精一杯さ。
column5: They used all their might, but could only damage it.
column11: They used their full might but were only able to damage it.

column4:
しかたないよ。やっぱり
マリオネーションギアが
なきゃ話にならない。
column5: There's nothing we can do. Without a Marionation Gear, it's just out of the question.
column11: There's nothing that can be done. It's not like you can negotiate with the Marionation Gear, after all.

column4: ガロイ親方＿戦闘中苦しい

column5: Blast it...
column11: Blast it...

column4: 私たちも避難しなきゃ。
column5: We need to get out of here.
column11: We need to get out of here.

column4:
名を上げるチャンスだぜ、
/p。
column5: Here's your shot at glory, /p.
column11: This is your chance to get your name out there, /p.

column5: You can do it.
column11: You can do it.

column4: オートマンを止めるんだ。
column5: You can stop the Automan.
column11: Stop the Automan.

column5: Don't be stupid!
column11: Don't be stupid!

column4:
今日はじめてマリオネーション
ギアに乗ったやつが、そんなこ
とできるか！
column5: You think a kid piloting a Marionation Gear for the first time today can do something like that!?
column11: It's his first time even piloting the Marionation Gear!

column4: ガロイ親方＿機嫌が悪い

それに、オートマンを作った
のは、天才人形師ファウスト
だぞ。
column5: That Automan was created by the genius Puppetmaker Faust.
column11: Besides, the Automan was created by the ingenious Puppet Maker Faust.

column4:
こんなポンコツで
勝てる相手じゃない。
column5: This hunk of junk doesn't stand a chance of winning.
column11: That hunk of junk doesn't stand a chance at winning.

column4:
でも相手は、自警団の攻撃で
ダメージを受けてるんだろ。
column5: But the enemy got damaged in the vigilantes' attack.
column11: But the enemy was damaged during the vigilantes' attack.

column4:
手負いの相手なら、
なんとかなる。
column5: Against a wounded opponent, we might just pull through.
column11: Against a wounded opponent, he might just pull through.

column5: Heh heh heh.
column11: Heh heh heh.

column4:
実は/c5武器/c3をつけてあるんだ。
こんなこともあろうかとね。
column5: To tell you the truth, I actually installed /c5weapons/c3. I wondered if they might come in handy.
column11: To tell you the truth, I actually installed a /c5weapon/c3. I wondered if it might come in handy.

column5: WHAT!?
column11: What!?

column5: When did you do that!?

column11: When did you do that!?

column4:
/p、よく聞けよ。
/c5ボタン/c3を押せば、
武器が発射されるぞ。
column5: /p, listen carefully. Press the /c5buttons/c3 to fire your weapons.
column11: /p, listen carefully. Press the /c5buttons/c3, to fire your weapons.

column4: メリッサ＿ちょっとした驚き

ゴッドフリードのコクピットに
ボタンなんかないよ！
column5: There's nothing like a {button} in Godfried's cockpit!
column11: There's no buttons like that in Godfried's cockpit!

column4:
コクピットの左側に
/c5何もない部分/c3があるだろ。
そこを/c5叩き割れ！！/c3
column5: They're in the /c5empty area/c3 on the left side of the control panel. Give that /c5a good whack!/c3
column11: The /c5empty area/c3 on the left side of the control panel. Give that /c5a good whack!!/c3
